SEARCH
Package model

Class Admin

java.lang.Object
model.User
model.Admin
public class Admin extends User
Represents an administrator user in the airport management system.

This class extends the User class to provide administrator-specific functionality within the airport management system. Administrators have elevated privileges compared to regular customers and can perform administrative tasks such as flight management, passenger check-in operations, and system configuration.

Unlike regular customers, administrators are required to have an email address for account creation and communication purposes. This class inherits all basic user functionality from the User parent class while serving as a marker class to distinguish administrative users from regular customers in the system.

Administrative users can access specialized interfaces and perform operations such as:

  • Managing flight schedules and status
  • Processing passenger check-ins
  • Handling lost luggage reports
  • Adding new flights to the system
  • Managing booking confirmations
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Admin

      public Admin(String parUsername, String parEmail, String parHashedPassword)
      Constructs a new Admin with the specified username, email, and hashed password.

      Creates an administrator user account with all required information. Unlike regular customers, administrators must provide an email address during account creation as it is used for administrative communications and system notifications.

      The password should be provided in hashed format for security purposes and cannot be changed after object creation due to the immutable nature of the password field inherited from the parent User class.

      Parameters:
      parUsername - the username for the administrator account. Must not be null or empty. This serves as the primary identifier for login purposes.
      parEmail - the email address for the administrator account. Must not be null or empty. This is required for administrative communications and system notifications.
      parHashedPassword - the hashed password for the administrator account. Must not be null or empty. The password is stored in hashed format for security purposes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null or empty
      See Also:
      • User(String, String, String)
